Extreme heat is causing more drownings in France
description: The number of drownings at the start of summer 2025 was twice as high as during the same period the previous year. This increase is linked to the early onset of heatwaves, which have driven people to swim in rivers and lakes that are minimally or not at all supervised.

headline: Wildfires blaze in southern France: 'It looked like the apocalypse'
Trump's tariffs take effect, ushering in a new world trade order
French foreign trade deficit widens even before new tariffs take effect
description: In the first half of the year, the value of imports outpaced exports by €43 billion, according to figures published on Thursday. For the first time in its history, France posted a deficit in pharmaceuticals.

headline: India-US alliance weakened by trade, Pakistan and oil disputes
description: The trade war between Washington and New Delhi, the US rapprochement with Pakistan and efforts to isolate Russia – India's main oil supplier – are all threatening the traditional alliance between the two countries.

headline: Success of French anti-pesticide petition revives interest in the political tool
description: A petition against the 'Duplomb Law' has become the second most signed in French history, and the first of its kind on a parliamentary platform. However, its impact will likely remain symbolic.

headline: In rural France, young people keep the local tradition of partying alive
description: 'Why Do We Party?' (1/6). In eastern Rignieu-le-Désert, the Amicale Des Jeunes youth association upholds the tradition of local balls, a custom that in some places is now seen as a way of preserving local identity.

Mojgan Habibi, chef: 'Before, I was afraid of everything. Now, I have found my freedom'
description: 'Refuge Recipes' (4/6). Iranian native Mojgan Habibi is the breakfast chef at Hôtel du Couvent in Nice. Khoresht mast, a dish reserved for special occasions and made with yogurt, spices, honey and meat, brings back memories of her happy youth in Isfahan before her marriage, when she was free to create and sing.

headline: Agnès Varda's Parisian wanderings at the Musée Carnavalet
description: An original exhibition focuses on the artist's relationship with Paris, highlighting her photographic work and her atelier in the 14th arrondissement.

headline: Eighty years after Hiroshima and Nagasaki bombings, the fight for survivors' memories to live on
description: In Japan, the two cities have long promoted peace and nuclear disarmament, led by survivors of the 1945 nuclear bombings. As their voices fade, both cities are striving to carry their message forward.
